elements.text: Two questions: 1) Does a generic struct increase performance? If I have something like this, is this perfectly acceptable?
and if I know the sizes of
is there a way I can preallocate? Maybe

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

increase performance compare to what? I think the answer is no.

Allocation happens when you make a instance, you can make a constructor that pre-allocate
